snippet: Mr. Silver, 71, one of the state’s most powerful politicians, will automatically forfeit the Assembly seat to which he was first elected nearly 40 years ago.
abstract: Former New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver is found guilty on all seven counts of federal corruption charges; speedy end to trial points up government's attempt to expose corrupt culture of influence-peddling in Albany; Silver once held viselike grip on power.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Mr. Silver, 71, one of the state’s most powerful politicians, will automatically forfeit the Assembly seat to which he was first elected nearly 40 years ago.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver, Ex-New York Assembly Speaker, Is Found Guilty on All Counts
headline.print_headline: Silver Convicted on All 7 Counts in U.S. Graft Case
